communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: City of Novato 647 PC Inquiry
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All citations, tickets, reports, collated data etc that indicate the number and location of citations/arrests made under PC 647(e) and Novato Municipal Code 14-20

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robbie Powelson

title: City of Berkeley  Ohlone & and Harrison Unhoused Communications

title: Request for Correctional Mental Health Staff Directory and Contact Information (Department of Corrections)

communications.subject: Mississippi Public Records Act Request: Request for Correctional Mental Health Staff Directory and Contact Information (Department of Corrections)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Mississippi Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting a list of currently employed mental health professionals within your state's Department of Corrections or its subsidiary agencies, as well as their contact information.

Specifically, I am requesting:

- Full names
- Job titles
- Assigned correctional facility
- Government-issued email addresses
- Government-issued phone numbers (direct desk numbers if available, otherwise department phone numbers with or without extensions)
- Department/division (e.g. Behavioral Health, Mental Health Services)

This request applies to the following roles: rehabilitative program coordinators, licensed psychologists, psychiatrists, clinical social workers, and other licensed mental health professionals serving incarcerated populations in state-operated facilities.

If available, I request this information be provided in a machine-readable format such as CSV or Excel.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Ma

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: R000696-051525
communications.communication:
Dear Andrew Ma: 
This email is written notice that the Mississippi Department of Corrections (“MDOC”) has received your public records request. Pursuant to the provisions of Miss. Code Ann. § 25-61-5(1)(b), MDOC is providing notice that a response is anticipated in fourteen (14) days due to a significantly heavy workload. The reference number R000696-051525 for tracking purposes: Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Mississippi Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting a list of currently employed mental health professionals within your state's Department of Corrections or its subsidiary agencies, as well as their contact information.

Specifically, I am requesting:

- Full names
- Job titles
- Assigned correctional facility
- Government-issued email addresses
- Government-issued phone numbers (direct desk numbers if available, otherwise department phone numbers with or without extensions)
- Department/division (e.g. Behavioral Health, Mental Health Services)

This request applies to the following roles: rehabilitative program coordinators, licensed psychologists, psychiatrists, clinical social workers, and other licensed mental health professionals serving incarcerated populations in state-operated facilities.

If available, I request this information be provided in a machine-readable format such as CSV or Excel.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Ma

communications.subject: RE: Mississippi Public Records Act Request #R000696-051525
communications.communication:
Hi,

Thank you for your response.

If a complete list of mental health staff is not available, would it be possible to share the names and work contact information for one or two individuals responsible for the oversight or coordination of mental health programming within Mississippi DOC facilities?

I understand if the information isn’t centrally compiled, but even a partial response or direction to someone involved in program coordination or behavioral health leadership would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks again for your time and assistance.

Warm regards,
Andrew Ma

communications.subject: RE: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request #MR 186605
communications.communication:
Dear Matt,

Thank you for your quick assistance.

I understand that Missouri DOC contracts its medical and mental health services through Centurion Health. I’m reaching out to respectfully request the following:
	1.	The name and email address of the relevant Centurion Health point of contact for mental or behavioral health services in Missouri DOC facilities.
	2.	The name(s) and contact information for MDOC personnel who oversee mental health programming or coordinate external rehabilitative initiatives, particularly those involving mindfulness, trauma-informed care, or wellness programming.

I’m currently conducting outreach to explore interest in offering a free, evidence-based meditation program for incarcerated individuals. To do so responsibly, I’d like to speak with the appropriate individuals — whether within Centurion or MDOC — to understand if this might be aligned with existing priorities.

I’m not requesting any confidential records, only public-facing professional contact information.

Thanks again for your time and support.

Warmly,
Andrew Ma
Vipassana Prison Trust

communications.subject: RE: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request #MR 186605
communications.communication:
The current Centurion Contract can be obtained at the following website: Contract Board | MissouriBUYS Statewide eProcurement System<https://missouribuys.mo.gov/contractboard>

You will need to search for the following contract information:
CS210318001 for Centurion.

communications.subject: RE: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request #MR 186605
communications.communication:
Thank you for providing this information! Do you have any information on the second part of the revised request? 

2. The name(s) and contact information for MDOC personnel who oversee mental health programming or coordinate external rehabilitative initiatives, particularly those involving mindfulness, trauma-informed care, or wellness programming.

These would be individuals who work directly with Centurion in the individual facilities themselves. 

Andrew

communications.subject: RE: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request #MR 186605
communications.communication: I am not sure what you are asking, but if it cannot be obtained from Centurion, I believe this information can be found on our website:  www.doc.mo.gov.

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] Hawaii Uniform Information Practices Act Request: Request for Correctional Mental Health Staff Directory and Contact Information (Hawaii Department Of Corrections)
communications.communication:
Dear Andrew,

Thank you for your email. We are reviewing your request and will get back to you.



Sincerely,

Office of the Director
Hawai‘i Department of Corrections and Rehabilitation
1177 Alakea Street, 6th floor
Honolulu, HI 96813
Phone: (808) 587-1288
Fax: (808) 587-1282
Website: dcr.hawaii.gov<http://www.dcr.hawaii.gov/>



CONFIDENTIALITY NOTICE:  This email message, including any attachments, is for the sole use of the intended recipient(s) and may contain information that is confidential and/or privileged.  If you are not the intended recipient, any unauthorized review, use, disclosure, distribution or copying of this communication is strictly prohibited. If you have received this communication in error, please contact the sender immediately by reply email, and delete the original and any copies of this message.

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] Hawaii Uniform Information Practices Act Request: Request for Correctional Mental Health Staff Directory and Contact Information (Hawaii Department Of Corrections)
communications.communication:
Mr. Ma,

This is to confirm that our office received your request and informing you that we are currently working on obtaining records pertaining to your request and will need additional time. This request will need to be handled through the following process.

Pursuant to HRS §92F, and the Office of information Practices Administrative Rules, §2-71-19, when a person requests access to a government record under Part II of Chapter 92F, HRS, the agency may charge the requester:

(a) (1) Fees for searching, reviewing, and segregating the record; provided that these fees shall be assessed in accordance with this chapter; and
(b) An agency may require a requester to prepay the following before an agency begins the search for and review of records in order to respond to a request for access:

(1) Fifty percent of the total estimated fees for searching, for reviewing, and segregating records when the estimated fees exceed $30;
(2) One hundred percent of the estimated fees from previous requests, including abandoned requests, in accordance with subsection (d).

Accordingly, in any request for information to DCR, the following charges apply for responsive documents: 1) @2.50 for each 15-minute period of search time; 2) $5.00 for each 15-minute period of review time and segregation; and 3) $0.50 per page for documents copied/digitized. The information that you seek is not readily available and will require a manual search, review, and segregation time. The estimated cost cannot be calculated at this time as I need a response from the section where we would obtain this information from. I will keep you updated as soon as I can, you will be notified of the final balance with payment due prior to releasing the information should there be any.

Thank you,
Cheyenne Evans
Department of Corrections & Rehabilitation
Litigation Coordination Office
Acting Departmental Program Officer / PREA Coordinator
Certified DOJ PREA Auditor
1177 Alakea St.
Honolulu, HI 96813

This email (including attachments) is covered by the Electronic Communications Privacy Act, 18 USC 2510-2521 and is confidential.  If you are not the intended recipient, you are hereby notified that any retention, dissemination, distribution, or copying of this communication is strictly prohibited.  This electronic transmission is for the sole use of those identified by the author and is the property of the author.  Any further distribution or copying of this message is prohibited by law.  If you received this in error, please notify the author and destroy the message immediately.

communications.subject: RE: Hawaii Uniform Information Practices Act Request: Request for Correctional Mental Health Staff Directory and Contact Information (Hawaii Department Of Corrections)
communications.communication:
Hi Cheyenne,

Thank you for your detailed response and for beginning to process my request. I appreciate you outlining the applicable procedures and fee structure.

I understand that the information may require manual search and review, and I'll wait for your update once the relevant section has responded and an estimate is available.

Thanks again for your help, and I look forward to hearing from you.

Warm regards,
Andrew Ma

communications.subject: RE: New Public Records Request: Andrew Ma - healthcare staffing
communications.communication:
Hi Andrew,

Thank you for your email which includes a records request related to staffing, submitted to the North Carolina Department of Adult Correction.

I am unsure if NCDAC has a readily available record containing all of the information requested in your inquiry.  I will reach out to my colleagues in healthcare staffing and determine what documents NCDAC has that are responsive to your request.

As soon as I have additional information available for you, I will reach out again.  In the interim, please feel free to reach out to me directly if you have additional questions or concerns related to this matter.

Thank you again for your email and for your interest in the NCDAC.

Amy Weinke
Communications Office, Public Records Manager
North Carolina Department of Adult Correction
Amy.h.weinke@dac.nc.gov<mailto:Amy.h.weinke@dac.nc.gov>

E-mail correspondence sent to and from this address may be subject to the provisions of G.S. 132-1, the North Carolina Public Records Law, and may be subject to monitoring and disclosed to third parties, including law enforcement personnel, by an authorized state official.

communications.subject: RE: North Carolina Public Records Law Request: Request for Correctional Mental Health Staff Directory and Contact Information (North Carolina Department of Corrections)
communications.communication:
Hi Amy,

Thank you so much for your thoughtful response — I really appreciate your willingness to look into this and reach out to your colleagues in healthcare staffing.

To give you a bit of background: I’m part of a grassroots meditation group that’s offering free, trauma-informed mindfulness programs to support the mental health of incarcerated individuals. We’ve been running these programs in community and retreat settings, and are now reaching out to state departments to see if there’s interest in offering this kind of support within correctional facilities.

I’m hoping to connect with the licensed mental health professionals currently working in NCDAC facilities — psychologists, psychiatrists, social workers, or counselors — to gauge whether this kind of offering might complement their existing work or wellness programming.

For the records request itself, I’m looking for any of the following information you might have available:
	•	Full name
	•	Job title
	•	Assigned facility (if known)
	•	Government-issued work email (or phone if email isn’t available)

I completely understand if there isn’t a single document containing all of this — even a partial list or direction to the right person or system would be incredibly helpful. I’m also happy to refine the scope or format if that would make it easier to fulfill.

Thank you again for your time and consideration, and please don’t hesitate to reach out if any clarification would be useful.

Warm regards,
Andrew Ma
